title: 'Billy on the Street' returns with Will Ferrell for Kamala Harris
text: Loud White Guys for Kamala! Vice President Kamala Harris has been stacking up celebrity endorsements from Beyoncé to Eminem to Taylor Swift. Today, she got the roaring support of Will Ferrell and Billy Eichner, who are representing the voting block known as Loud White Men For Harris. A cheeky parody of Megan Thee Stallion's "Hotties for Harris" rallying cry, Eichner returned to the sidewalks of New York City with a reprisal of his Billy on the Street schtick. Ambushing pedestrians with hard-hitting questions like "Who are you voting for?" and "Would you have sex with a Trump voter?" Make no mistake, Eichner's passion for his candidate won't curb his signature acerbic wit! Kristy Puchko is the Film Editor at Mashable. Based in New York City, she's an established film critic and entertainment reporter, who has traveled the world on assignment, covered a variety of film festivals, co-hosted movie-focused podcasts, interviewed a wide array of performers and filmmakers, and had her work published on RogerEbert.com, Vanity Fair, and The Guardian. A member of the Critics Choice Association and GALECA as well as a Top Critic on Rotten Tomatoes, Kristy's primary focus is movies. However, she's also been known to gush over television, podcasts, and board games. You can follow her on Twitter. This newsletter may contain advertising, deals, or affiliate links. Subscribing to a newsletter indicates your consent to our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You may unsubscribe from the newsletters at any time.
html:
Loud White Guys for Kamala!

Vice President Kamala Harris has been stacking up celebrity endorsements from Beyoncé to Eminem to Taylor Swift. Today, she got the roaring support of Will Ferrell and Billy Eichner, who are representing the voting block known as Loud White Men For Harris.

A cheeky parody of Megan Thee Stallion's "Hotties for Harris" rallying cry, Eichner returned to the sidewalks of New York City with a reprisal of his Billy on the Street schtick. Ambushing pedestrians with hard-hitting questions like "Who are you voting for?" and "Would you have sex with a Trump voter?"

Make no mistake, Eichner's passion for his candidate won't curb his signature acerbic wit!

Kristy Puchko is the Film Editor at Mashable. Based in New York City, she's an established film critic and entertainment reporter, who has traveled the world on assignment, covered a variety of film festivals, co-hosted movie-focused podcasts, interviewed a wide array of performers and filmmakers, and had her work published on RogerEbert.com, Vanity Fair, and The Guardian. A member of the Critics Choice Association and GALECA as well as a Top Critic on Rotten Tomatoes, Kristy's primary focus is movies. However, she's also been known to gush over television, podcasts, and board games. You can follow her on Twitter.
